data.title: Raffles Interior Flags Legal Appeal Risk to 2025 Audit and Capital Plans
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Raffles Interior Ltd. ( (HK:1376) ) has issued an announcement.

Raffles Interior Limited has scheduled a consequential hearing in the Grand Court of the Cayman Islands on 4 March 2026 to address matters arising from a judgment that discharged a prior injunction order restricting its issuance and listing of new shares. The plaintiff in the case has applied for leave to appeal and for a stay of that court order, which, if granted, could reinstate or extend the injunction’s restrictive effects.

The company warns that any stay of the discharge order may prolong limitations on issuing new shares and engaging placement agents, constraining its options to address external auditors’ integrity and audit concerns. Management cautions that this could further jeopardise the timely completion of the audit for the year ended 31 December 2025 and hinder publication of its 2025 audited annual results by 31 March 2026, potentially affecting shareholders and investors.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:1376) stock is a Hold with a HK$0.12 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on Raffles Interior Ltd. stock, see the HK:1376 Stock Forecast page.

More about Raffles Interior Ltd.

Raffles Interior Limited, incorporated in the Cayman Islands and listed in Hong Kong, operates in the interiors and fit-out sector, providing design and construction-related services. The company targets commercial and other property projects in Asian markets, where its access to capital and regulatory compliance are key to sustaining operations and growth.

Average Trading Volume: 3,076,190

Technical Sentiment Signal: Sell

Current Market Cap: HK$150M

Learn more about 1376 stock on TipRanks’ Stock Analysis page.

data.title: China BlueChemical Hands Fudao Chemical Operations to CNOOC Unit Under De Minimis Connected Deal
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

China BlueChemical ( (HK:3983) ) just unveiled an announcement.

China BlueChemical has moved to deepen operational integration within the CNOOC group by entrusting CNOOC Oil & Petrochemicals with the daily production and operations management of its affiliate Fudao Chemical from March 2026 to February 2029. The arrangement is designed to tap Orient Petrochemical’s role as Fudao’s main raw material supplier and its established expertise in acrylonitrile and other chemical products to cut costs, optimize resource allocation, and improve efficiency at Fudao.

The transaction is classified as a continuing connected transaction under Hong Kong listing rules because both CNOOC Oil & Petrochemicals and Fudao Chemical are connected entities, but its size falls below the 0.1% threshold, rendering it a de minimis deal exempt from independent shareholder approval, annual review, and additional disclosure. Profit-sharing and loss-bearing arrangements between Orient Petrochemical and CNOOC Fudao for Fudao Chemical remain unchanged, suggesting limited immediate financial impact but incremental operational benefits and tighter group-level coordination for stakeholders.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:3983) stock is a Buy with a HK$3.00 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on China BlueChemical stock, see the HK:3983 Stock Forecast page.

More about China BlueChemical

China BlueChemical is a mainland China-based chemical producer listed in Hong Kong, operating within the petrochemicals and fertilizers sector under the umbrella of state-owned energy giant CNOOC. Its portfolio includes chemical products such as acrylonitrile, and it leverages integration with CNOOC’s oil and petrochemical supply chain to enhance cost efficiency and industrial synergies across its subsidiaries and joint ventures.

YTD Price Performance: 20.66%

Average Trading Volume: 3,232,894

Technical Sentiment Signal: Buy

Current Market Cap: HK$13.46B

For an in-depth examination of 3983 stock, go to TipRanks’ Overview page.

data.title: CRRC Names Veteran State-Enterprise Executive Qu Xiaoli as New CFO
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

CRRC ( (HK:1766) ) has issued an announcement.

CRRC Corporation Limited has appointed Qu Xiaoli as its chief financial officer and chief accountant, following the resignation of the previous CFO, with his term running from the board’s approval on 28 February 2026 until the end of the current board session. Qu, a senior accountant and member of the company’s Party Committee standing committee, brings extensive financial and managerial experience from senior roles at China National Materials Group and China National Building Material Group, underscoring CRRC’s emphasis on seasoned state-enterprise financial leadership at a time when governance and financial stewardship remain central for stakeholders.

As part of the announcement, CRRC also reaffirmed the current composition of its board, including executive, non-executive, independent non-executive and employee directors. The move signals continuity and stability in the company’s top governance structure, providing investors and other stakeholders with clarity on financial oversight and leadership during the remaining tenure of the fourth session board.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:1766) stock is a Hold with a HK$6.40 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on CRRC stock, see the HK:1766 Stock Forecast page.

More about CRRC

CRRC Corporation Limited is a Chinese state-owned rail equipment manufacturer listed in Hong Kong, focusing on the design and production of rolling stock, rail transit equipment and related services. The company plays a key role in China’s rail infrastructure supply chain and serves both domestic and international railway markets.

Average Trading Volume: 14,759,456

Current Market Cap: HK$199.9B

data.title: Yum China Lifts Profit and Expands Network as Delivery and Membership Surge in 2025
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

The latest announcement is out from Yum China Holdings ( (YUMC) ).

Yum China reported 4% year-on-year revenue growth to $11.8 billion in 2025, supported by 4% system sales growth and a 1% rise in same-store sales. The company expanded aggressively, adding 1,706 net new stores to reach 18,101 locations by year-end, and continued to deepen its customer base with total KFC and Pizza Hut membership surpassing 590 million and active members rising 13%.

Profitability improved, with operating profit up 11% and operating margin and restaurant margin each widening by 60 basis points, while diluted EPS climbed 8%. Yum China also ramped up its delivery-driven, digitally enabled model, with delivery accounting for 48% of sales after 25% growth, and returned $1.5 billion to shareholders through dividends and share buybacks, underscoring confidence in its cash generation and long-term growth trajectory.

More about Yum China Holdings

Yum China Holdings, Inc. operates quick-service and casual dining restaurants in China under leading brands such as KFC and Pizza Hut. The company focuses on the Chinese consumer market with a mix of company-operated and franchised stores, emphasizing digital engagement, delivery services, and a large membership ecosystem to drive recurring traffic and sales.

data.title: Dragon Rise Reshapes Board Committees After Independent Director Resignation
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Dragon Rise Group Holdings Ltd. ( (HK:6829) ) has provided an announcement.

Dragon Rise Group Holdings Limited announced that independent non-executive director Mr. Lee Kwok Lun will resign with effect from 28 February 2026, stepping down as chairman of the audit committee and member of the nomination committee, citing other business and personal commitments. The company emphasized there is no disagreement with the board or outstanding claims arising from his departure and expressed appreciation for his contributions.

To maintain continuity in governance oversight, the board appointed existing independent non-executive director Ms. Ding Xin as chairlady of the audit committee and Mr. Bok Kwok Ming Aaron as a committee member from 28 February 2026. In addition, independent non-executive director Mr. Chan Wa Shing was named a member of the nomination committee, signaling a reshuffle of key committee roles while keeping these functions under the supervision of experienced non-executive board members.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:6829) stock is a Hold with a HK$2.50 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on Dragon Rise Group Holdings Ltd. stock, see the HK:6829 Stock Forecast page.

More about Dragon Rise Group Holdings Ltd.

Dragon Rise Group Holdings Limited is a Cayman Islands–incorporated company listed on the Stock Exchange of Hong Kong under stock code 6829. Its board comprises executive and independent non-executive directors overseeing governance, audit, and nomination functions for the group’s operations and corporate strategy.

Average Trading Volume: 352,106

Technical Sentiment Signal: Buy

Current Market Cap: HK$806.4M

data.title: MOIL Raises Manganese Ore Prices Across Key Grades for February 2026
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

The latest announcement is out from Moil Limited ( (IN:MOIL) ).

MOIL Limited has revised prices for various manganese ore grades for February 2026 within the January–March 2026 quarter, largely implementing a 5% increase on ferro grades with manganese content above and below 44%, SMGR (Mn-30%) and fines grades, and all chemical grades, effective from midnight of January 31 to February 1. Prices for certain lower-grade SMGR products, most Metal Mandi fines, and Electrolytic Manganese Dioxide have been kept unchanged, while one Metal Mandi fines grade, UKF532, has seen a sharper 10% hike, signaling a calibrated pricing strategy that may support margins while balancing demand across product segments for its industrial customer base.

More about Moil Limited

MOIL Limited is a Government of India enterprise engaged in the mining and production of manganese ore, a key raw material for the steel and chemical industries. The company supplies various ferro, chemical and fines grades of manganese ore to domestic industrial customers, positioning itself as a crucial link in India’s metals and alloys value chain.

Average Trading Volume: 57,810

Technical Sentiment Signal: Sell

Current Market Cap: 62.49B INR

data.title: Geely Sales Edge Higher as PHEVs and Exports Offset Core Brand Weakness
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Geely Automobile Holdings ( (HK:0175) ) has shared an announcement.

Geely Automobile reported unaudited sales of 206,160 vehicles in February 2026, up about 1% year on year, bringing year-to-date deliveries to 476,327 units, also 1% higher than a year earlier. The core Geely-branded line saw an 11% decline in February, partly offset by strong growth at LYNK & CO, whose sales jumped 59%, and ZEEKR, which surged 70%, underscoring shifting demand within the group’s portfolio.

New energy vehicle performance was mixed, with February sales of battery electric vehicles falling 6% while plug-in hybrids nearly doubled, rising 89%, highlighting a consumer tilt toward PHEVs. Exports were a bright spot, climbing 138% in February and 129% year to date, while associated brand Proton recorded a 14% February sales increase and 25% growth for the first two months, suggesting that Geely’s overseas and partner-brand strategy is becoming an increasingly important growth driver despite softer domestic BEV volumes.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:0175) stock is a Buy with a HK$22.00 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on Geely Automobile Holdings stock, see the HK:0175 Stock Forecast page.

More about Geely Automobile Holdings

Geely Automobile Holdings Limited is a Chinese automotive manufacturer incorporated in the Cayman Islands and listed in Hong Kong. The group produces a broad range of passenger vehicles under brands including Geely, LYNK & CO and premium EV marque ZEEKR, with a growing focus on new energy vehicles and export markets outside mainland China.

YTD Price Performance: -9.78%

Average Trading Volume: 43,709,359

data.title: SML Mahindra Posts 17% Rise in February Sales, Cargo Segment Leads YTD Growth
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

The latest announcement is out from Sml Isuzu Limited ( (IN:SMLMAH) ).

SML Mahindra Limited reported that its total vehicle sales in February 2026 rose to 1,503 units, a 17% increase over the same month last year, driven by 4% growth in cargo vehicles and a stronger 24% rise in passenger vehicles. For the April–February period of FY 2025-26, total sales climbed 19% year-on-year to 14,175 units, with cargo vehicle volumes up 33% and passenger vehicles up 13%, indicating robust demand across its product portfolio and a strengthening position in the commercial vehicle segment.

The sustained double-digit growth in both monthly and year-to-date sales suggests improved market traction for SML Mahindra’s trucks and buses, particularly in the cargo category where expansion has been most pronounced. This performance highlights a favorable operating environment and may signal increased utilization and investment in commercial transport, with positive implications for the company’s revenue momentum and competitive standing in the Indian commercial vehicle market.

More about Sml Isuzu Limited

SML Mahindra Limited, formerly SML Isuzu Limited, operates in the commercial vehicle industry, manufacturing and selling trucks and buses. The company focuses on cargo and passenger vehicles for the Indian market, serving both goods transportation and public or private passenger mobility needs.

Technical Sentiment Signal: Buy

data.title: TG Therapeutics Confronts Rising AI Regulatory and IP Risks That Could Pressure Costs, Strategy, and Growth
data.description:
TG Therapeutics (TGTX) has disclosed a new risk, in the Technology category.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

TG Therapeutics faces emerging risks as it incorporates AI technologies into its operations, given rapidly evolving and fragmented regulatory frameworks in the U.S., EU, and other jurisdictions. Uncertain implementation standards, potential AI‑washing scrutiny, and new compliance obligations could raise costs and constrain how it deploys AI in its business.

The company is also exposed to intellectual property uncertainties around AI‑related inputs and outputs, which may limit its ability to secure or enforce protection for AI‑driven innovations. Competitors’ or third parties’ IP claims, along with future laws affecting data privacy, antitrust, and automated decision‑making, could impair its competitive position, financial condition, and growth prospects.

Overall, Wall Street has a Moderate Buy consensus rating on TGTX stock based on 3 Buys, 1 Sell and 1 Hold.

To learn more about TG Therapeutics’ risk factors, click here.
